abstract: Drug Enforcement Administration reports that three Colombians suspected of laundering more than $5 billion for drug cartels using Chinese counterfeit market have been arrested; suspected ringleaders Christian Duque-Aristizabal and Jhon Hincapie-Ramirez are being held in Latin America, and third defendant, Henry Poveda, pleads not guilty in Brooklyn court.
lead_paragraph: Using the Chinese counterfeit market, a group of Colombians “provided the lifeline for drug cartels to operate and push illegal drugs into the United States,” the Drug Enforcement Administration said.

headline.main: 3 Men Laundered Over $5 Billion for Drug Cartels, U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: 3 Men Laundered Cartels’ Money, U.S. Says

snippet: Using the Chinese counterfeit market, a group of Colombians “provided the lifeline for drug cartels to operate and push illegal drugs into the United States,” the Drug Enforcement Administration said.
